name: seqeq3d
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0
body: |- wi(w0, wceq(cseq(c0, c1, c2), cseq(c0, c1, c3)))

stmt.origin: syl(w0, wceq(cseq(c0, c1, c2), cseq(c0, c1, c3)), wceq(c2, c3))
stmt.pretty: syl(w0, seq(c0(c1, c2))= seq(c0(c1, c3)), c2 = c3)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(cseq(c0, c1, c2), cseq(c0, c1, c3)))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c2, c3))
-| wi(wceq(c2, c3), wceq(cseq(c0, c1, c2), cseq(c0, c1, c3)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(cseq(c0, c1, c2), cseq(c0, c1, c3)))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c2, c3))
-| wi(wceq(c2, c3), wceq(cseq(c0, c1, c2), cseq(c0, c1, c3)))

body.origin: |- wi(wceq(c2, c3), wceq(cseq(c0, c1, c2), cseq(c0, c1, c3)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(cseq(c0, c1, c2), cseq(c0, c1, c3)))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c2, c3))

comment: Equality deduction for the sequence builder operation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Sep-2013.)
